homePage.title: What does "Astula" mean?
homePage.p1: The word Astula comes from Latin and is known in modern language as Atelier, a workshop or studio, esp. of an artist, artisan, or designer.
homePage.p2: 1830â€“40; < F: lit., pile of chips (hence, workshop); OF astele  chip (< LL astella,  dim. of L astula,  var. of assula splinter, equiv. to ass ( is ) plank + -ula -ule) + -ier -ier.
homePage.p3: Original meaning of Astula was a plank of wood, little piece that originates a creation. Here comes our statement - we provide unique and original materials and manufacturers in USA for creative professionals, studios and atelier
